Name: Alto Paraguay
Description: Located in the western part of Paraguay, known for its vast forests, rivers, and wildlife.

Name: Alto Parana
Description: Located in the eastern part of Paraguay, known for its agricultural activities and proximity to the Paraná River.

Name: Asuncion
Description: The capital and largest city of Paraguay, known for its urban development and cultural significance.

Name: Boqueron
Description: Located in the western region, known for its agricultural activities and vast plains.

Name: Caaguazu
Description: Located in the central part of the country, known for its agriculture, especially corn and soybeans.

Name: Caazapá
Description: Known for its rolling hills and agricultural activities, particularly the cultivation of crops like soybeans.

Name: Canindeyú
Description: Located in the northeastern region, famous for its agriculture, particularly soybean production.

Name: Central
Description: The most populous region of Paraguay, with the capital city of Asunción and its metropolitan area.

Name: Concepción
Description: Located in the northern part of Paraguay, with fertile land and large cattle ranching industries.

Name: Cordillera
Description: Known for its mountainous terrain and agricultural activities, particularly the cultivation of crops like tobacco.

Name: Guairá
Description: Located in the southeastern region of Paraguay, known for its agriculture and rural communities.

Name: Itapúa
Description: Known for its large scale agricultural production, especially soybeans and corn.

Name: Misiones
Description: Located in the southeastern region, known for its agriculture and natural beauty.

Name: Ñeembucú
Description: A flat region located near the border with Argentina, known for its wetlands and agriculture.

Name: Paraguarí
Description: A region known for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of crops like soybeans, maize, and tobacco.

Name: Presidente Hayes
Description: Located in the western part of the country, known for its cattle ranching and agricultural industries.

Name: San Pedro
Description: Located in the central part of Paraguay, known for its agricultural production, particularly soybeans.
